SENT.plain: Two man presented with recurrent venous thrombosis
One of them also suffered from arterial thrombosis and aneurysm
Additional history-taking revealed that both suffered from recurrent oral and/or genital ulcers, erythema nodosum and iritis
Consequently a diagnosis of 'angio-Behçet syndrome' was made
Related to the clinical observations in these patients, we discuss the complications and the management of angio-Behçet syndrome
Treatment includes anticoagulants and immunosuppressive drugs
